ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
Measured in days; Calculation using First Episode of Psychosis date and date of consent;  datediff([pt_info_fepdate], [pt_info_consent_date], "d","mdy")

1= Participates in less than 30% of scheduled or recommended individual sessions or groups; 2= Participates in 30-60% of scheduled or recommended individual sessions or groups; 3= Participates in more than 60% of scheduled or recommended individual session or groups; 999= Not applicable

ElementDescription: Level of participation in medical management
Notes: 1= Participates in less than 30% of scheduled or recommended MD appointments; 2= Participates in 30-60% of scheduled or recommended MD appointments; 3= Participates in more than 60% of scheduled or recommended MD appointments; 999= Not applicable
1= Takes less than 30% of medications as prescribed; 2= Takes 30-60% of medications as prescribed; 3= Takes less than 60% of medications as prescribed; 999= Not applicable

ElementDescription: Level of participation in recovery services (case management, supportive education and employment)
Notes: 1=Participates in less than 30% of scheduled or recommended recovery services offered; 2=Participates in 30-60% of scheduled or recommended recovery services offered; 3=Participates in more than 60% of scheduled or recommended recovery services offered; 999=Not applicable
A CPZ-equivalent dose is typically defined as a dose of antipsychotic that is comparable to 100 mg of CPZ.
